meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to believe something that is not true.
meanings.sent1: The tricky magician deceives the audience with his magic tricks.
meanings.sent2: She deceives her friend by pretending to be someone else online.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat deceives its owner by pretending to be innocent.
meanings.sent4: The mirage in the desert deceives travelers, making them think they see water.
meanings.sent5: The con artist deceives people by promising them riches in exchange for money.

meanings.definition: Fail to admit to oneself that something is true.
meanings.sent1: He deceives himself into thinking he doesn't need help when he actually does.
meanings.sent2: She deceives herself into believing she is always right, even when she's wrong.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn child deceives himself into thinking he can eat all the cookies without getting caught.
meanings.sent4: The pessimist deceives himself into seeing only the negative side of things.
meanings.sent5: The procrastinator deceives himself into thinking he has plenty of time when deadlines are approaching.
